name: Magic square
description:
A square array of numbers, usually positive integers, is called a [Magic square](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_square). if the sums of the numbers in each row, each column, and both main diagonals are the same.

You need to construct a magic square ```(N x N)``` dimension with numbers ```{1, 2 ... N^2}```, each number can only be used 1 time.

For example:
```
2 7 6
9 5 1
4 3 8
```

Actually, it is possible to construct such magic square `$ \forall N \in \mathbb{N}$`, except ```N = 2```

In this kata all the tests will be with `$ 3 \leqslant N \leqslant 2000$`

Good luck!
